channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CEO of Japan’s Suntory, Takeshi Niinami, resigns after investigation into illegal supplements
item.description: Suntory Holdings CEO Takeshi Niinami, one of Japan’s best-known business leaders, has resigned from the beverage group following a police investigatio...

item.title: Funding cuts force nonprofits into influencer territory on YouTube, podcasts: ‘Storytelling is how we’re able to draw people in’
item.description: “If you’re telling those stories,” says Nicole Bronzan, “I can only imagine that people will be more inclined to open up their pocketbooks.”

item.title: Klarna Group reveals target IPO share price as stock listing date nears
item.description: Klarna Group, the Swedish fintech startup known for its popular buy now, pay later services, has reveled the target share price for its long-awaited i...

item.title: Nestle’s CEO is out after only a year, following probe into undisclosed relationship
item.description: Swiss food giant Nestlé said Monday it dismissed its CEO Laurent Freixe after an investigation into an undisclosed relationship with a direct subordin...

item.title: Nestlé picks insider to replace CEO fired over affair
item.description: Philipp Navratil is taking over as chief executive officer of the company known for its staid corporate culture.

item.title: Sanofi CEO: AI might beat IQ, not EQ — but never say never
item.description: We underestimate the scale of the AI learning curve, says Paul Hudson, CEO of Sanofi.

item.title: Census Bureau data reveals U.S. labor force has lost over 1.2 million immigrants
item.description: It’s tomato season and Lidia is harvesting on farms in California’s Central Valley . She is also anxious. Attention from U.S. Immigration and Customs ...

item.title: Should You Go to the Home of an Employee Who Doesn’t Show Up for Work?
item.description: In this case, an in-person check-in went very badly.

item.title: Payroll Tax Issues Can Block Your Funding. Here’s How to Stay Fundable
item.description: These hidden liabilities, sometimes forgotten by busy founders, can derail funding applications in an instant.

item.title: McDonald’s slashes prices to win back lower-income customers, offering Extra Value Meals at 15% discounts
item.description: CEO Chris Kempczinski said U.S. customers with household incomes of less than $45,000 per year no longer see McDonald's as good value.

item.title: History Says the Stock Market Is About to Fall This Month
item.description: September is the weakest month of the year for the S&P 500.

item.title: Companies That Allow Remote Work Grow 1.7X Faster, New Data Shows
item.description: Small firms are much more likely to allow remote work arrangements, the report also finds, and the gap is only set to grow.

item.title: 3 Ways to Empower Your Employees to Feel Engaged at Work
item.description: If your employees aren’t happy to be working for you, your customers will pick up on that in a flash.

item.title: Shrimp recall update: Radioactive worries hit Kroger and other retailers as full list of impacted products grows

item.title: Naomi Osaka’s Labubu obsession shines at the U.S. Open
item.description: She paid sparkly tribute to Althea Gibson, the tennis champion who broke the sport's color barrier 75 years ago. "Her name is Althea Glitterson."
